text: Hattie Ophelia Wyatt Caraway (February 1, 1878 â€” December 21, 1950) was the first woman elected to serve a full term in the United States Senate. She was the Senator from Arkansas for just over thirteen years (December 1931 to January 1945). Caraway had a stroke in 1950. She died later that year in Falls Church, Virginia due to this stroke. Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States senators from Arkansas Category:1878 births Category:1950 deaths
title: Hattie Caraway
